{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3194194,"name":"Bob Ellis","username":"Coach-Bob","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/8e7dd6/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-20T12:20:38.219Z","cooked":"

Theoretically, if we modify the top plate to mount a second drive motor whose pinion engages with the large drive gear, and choose a higher drive gear ratio, then we can accelerate faster and have faster top speed increasing number of cycles in any match. Are there limits to top speed allowed? Any input? anything I haven’t thought of… please critique…

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2023-04-20T12:20:38.219Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":734,"reads":812,"readers_count":811,"score":3842.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":435181,"topic_slug":"upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors","display_username":"Bob Ellis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59051,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coach Bob"},"post_url":"/t/upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors/435181/1","custom_user_title":"Coach Bob","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3194196,"name":"Dan","username":"theworkshope","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/theworkshope/{size}/194375_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-20T12:25:06.469Z","cooked":"

Throwing more motors at a problem has diminishing returns. You need to take into account any traction limits, and more importantly driver skill. A fast accelerating and fast moving robot is trickier to control on human scale time, so requires more practice in order to drive well.

This is also assuming that everything in your drivetrain/module can handle the additional torque.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2023-04-20T12:25:06.469Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":805,"readers_count":804,"score":201.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":435181,"topic_slug":"upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53412,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors/435181/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3194198,"name":"Ken Pontbriant","username":"electroken","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electroken/{size}/160387_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-20T12:27:50.885Z","cooked":"

I think FRC has pushed our 18 AH lead-acid batteries as far as they can go. Many of these batteries that on paper will deliver 100-200 charge cycles are toast at less than 50.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2023-04-20T12:27:50.885Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":767,"readers_count":766,"score":173.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":435181,"topic_slug":"upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors","display_username":"Ken Pontbriant","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17612,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 230 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors/435181/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 230 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3194233,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-20T13:08:37.961Z","cooked":"

You would, frankly, be better off utilizing the increase in performance that CTRE FOC provides rather than adding more motors.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2023-04-20T13:08:37.961Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":717,"readers_count":716,"score":158.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":435181,"topic_slug":"upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors/435181/4","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3194248,"name":"Lexeo","username":"Lexeo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lexeo/{size}/160041_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-20T13:55:35.103Z","cooked":"

You only have so much electrical current you can pull at a time. 4 falcons/Neos gets reasonably close to that limit.

Seems there are a few teams that are doing this successful this year, but they know what they are doing.

Id imagine you would get a bigger bang for your buck by making your robot lighter and making it have a really low CoM before you would get benefits from an 8 motors drive.

Look at the latest post on this thread…

Three Motor Swerve Module Technical Discussion
I was bored waiting for Champs to start… So I did this in like an hour-ish… [image] [image] It’s just a modified top plate to the MK4i that allows another Falcon to be slotted in that drives the same gear as the primary drive Falcon. Theres no changes to the ratio so it kinda defeats the purpose of adding more power, but hey it exists now… Link to CAD:

also HighTide is running something like that this year…

image_6487327828×1076 297 KB

2023","clicks":44},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/three-motor-swerve-module/414784/20","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Three Motor Swerve Module","clicks":39},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/tri-motor-diffy-swerve/435927/21","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Tri Motor Diffy Swerve","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50713,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6925 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/upgrade-swerve-mk4i-increase-acceleration-and-speed-w-2x-drive-motors/435181/6","custom_user_title":"6925 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3194254,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-20T14:10:25.843Z","cooked":"

I’m not certain of Hightide’s reasoning for doing that but one reason could be that they want to keep their motors cooler throughout the match.

ConstantCurrent1010×672 34.7 KB

The constant current graph shows that if you are trying to get the maximum output of the motor for the whole match it will overheat before the match ends. However, I don’t believe that you would really hit those limits under typical circumstances, but more motors could help for pushing matches.

My son used to race race go-karts competitively, there is an old adage in motor racing, “slow is fast”. Making the drive system faster may make it harder to drive. We have the older SDS Mk3 system. Our programmer worked with the driver to make the chassis easier to drive. We then tested it on our obstacle course and the drive was faster.

Again in motor racing, making the chassis “drivable” can make up for lack of HP.

Something to think about.

Mark

Tom_Line:

CTRE FOC

Im not sure… Center of Gravity? 30 pound belly pan made from steel ensures very low center of mass. yes we do need to worry about “wheelies” if top heavy… and acceleration limits would be part of PID

During our first regional (Central Illinois Regional) we ran with 2 falcons with custom top plates on each module. We struggled to have enough battery to finish the match and brownouts were always happening. For Seven Rivers and Worlds we were running a single falcon per module with much better results. I don’t recall the gearing we were using but I can find out if someone wants to know.
